confession.seduction_context: Returning from fields with Neze femme Erhard Schneyder. Neze invited her to a meeting in the fields and brought a young man to be her dance partner. She resisted at first, but the next day Neze persuaded her to come again to the garden behind Neze's house. The young man showed her a purse full of money (which was actually leaves), scratched her head, made her renounce God, and had intercourse with her.
powder_types: powder made from burned body of stillborn child mixed with urine of horses or cows
sabbat_locations: garden behind Neze's house in Assenoncourt
sabbat_activities: feasting on roast meat without bread or salt
attempting to make storms (frustrated by church bells)
nightly meetings to prepare poisonous drinks
making candles from fingers of stillborn children

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over alleged debt of 20 gros

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: continued after court case, illness occurred around last Rogations

witnesses.name: Didier Chatron
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: mayor who had to collect taxes from her

testimony.quarrel_subject: went to her house to take security for payment of aides; she was angry

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day after threat about horses eating oats

testimony.quarrel_subject: caught her husband carting 4 loads of logs from his woodland; took him to court at Dieuze
testimony.threat_quote: elle leur feroit tant de mal qu'il s'en sauleroit

testimony.quarrel_subject: his children took harness as caution for damage done by her husband's two horses
testimony.threat_quote: if he used this she hoped wolves would kill his horses

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 3 weeks later, same night after using harness

witnesses.name: Jean Gigoux
witnesses.location: jeune fils de Naffroicourt, residant à Assenoncourt
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: former lodger in her house for 18 months

testimony.quarrel_subject: left her house where he had been lodging

harms_alleged.harm_description: became very ill and lost speech for another 2 weeks; when convalescent she placed hand on his head in street and he recovered
harms_alleged.method_alleged: touch - placed hand on head to cure after causing illness

witnesses.name: Colas Barron
witnesses.location: jeune fils de Laffroicourt, demeurant à Assenoncourt

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over price of cartload of hay 15 years earlier; ended up not selling it to them
testimony.threat_quote: curse she had given him at time, as others reported to him

harms_alleged.harm_description: trouble in right arm which spread to left, as if knife had been put through them; so ill he was carried in sheet for 5 months; still had pain and could not use them for work

testimony.quarrel_subject: Odile sent soldiers to fetch flour from his house when garrison lodged overnight; his wife complained

harms_alleged.harm_description: such bad pain in her side she thought she would die; Odile then visited and told her she would recover

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: at same time as wife's illness

harms_alleged.harm_description: Odile gave his pregnant wife something to eat, after which she went into labour and had stillborn child

testimony.quarrel_subject: piglets belonging to Odile got into wife's bean garden; also horse belonging to Odile's husband knocked over shelf breaking pots for which she had to pay
testimony.threat_quote: que le diable luy ouisse arracher la teste du corps du deposant et qu'il en avoit menty

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 3 months after dispute about broken pots
harms_alleged.harm_description: became very ill and died after 7 weeks

witnesses.name: Thiebault Parmentier
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: former neighbor; his wife beat Odile's niece

testimony.quarrel_subject: his wife had beaten her niece who went to Odile crying

harms_alleged.harm_description: lost use of arms and hands, only recovered gradually, still unable to work properly

testimony.quarrel_subject: was loading dung to put on fields of George Creneillé when she spoke to him
testimony.threat_quote: pauvre compagnon, tu as bien de mal de ce que tu ne peulx recouvrir d'ung cher, nous estions dernierement en telle peine, car nous avions affaire d'une rouëe pour mettre à l'un de noz chers, et cerchions par tout le village mais nou n'en sceurons recouvrir sy tu ne nous en eusse prestee une des tiennes. L'on dict que je suis genoxe, je vouldrois estre diable tout à faict, j'en ferois tant que d'aulcuns s'en repentiroient longtemps.

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 3 days later found horse ill, died 4 or 5 days later

timeline.subject: Odile femme Martin Claude
timeline.details: Taken at request of Jean Blanchar, manouvrier d'Assenoncourt, partie formelle

timeline.subject: Odile femme Martin Claude
timeline.details: First interrogation; denied most accusations but admitted some details about quarrels

timeline.subject: Odile femme Martin Claude
timeline.details: Additional witness testimony from Jacquot Colas le Maire

timeline.subject: Odile femme Martin Claude
timeline.details: Continued to deny virtually all accusations

timeline.subject: Odile femme Martin Claude
timeline.details: No reproaches; maintained denials of many circumstantial details except those already admitted

timeline.subject: Odile femme Martin Claude
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; racked until she confessed; allowed respite until Vespers, then prepared for fresh torture which induced full confession

timeline.subject: Odile femme Martin Claude
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confessions and provided additional details about sabbat, accomplices, and maleficia

timeline.subject: Odile femme Martin Claude
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to death sentence

accomplices_named.name: Neze femme Erhard Schneyder
accomplices_named.context: Introduced Odile to witchcraft, brought her to first sabbat, persuaded her to yield to the devil

accomplices_named.name: Austien Thiebauld le daintre de la saline
accomplices_named.context: Mentioned by Neze's master as being wealthy and in their company

accomplices_named.name: Caspars Hanns
accomplices_named.context: Laboureur seen at sabbat feast and dance

accomplices_named.name: la Noire Magdelaine
accomplices_named.context: Sister of Didier Chatron, present at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Maiette femme Braittschwert
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice in later confession

prior_accusations.context: Odile's mother was previously executed as a witch; had recommended pilgrimage to Bel Bernard for bewitchment illnesses

notable_quotes.speaker: Odile Claude
notable_quotes.french: qu'on disoit qu'elle estoit une sorciere, mais qu'elle vouldroit estre tous les diables et qu'elle en romproit le col à d'aulcuns
notable_quotes.english: that they said she was a witch, but that she wished she were all the devils and that she would break the neck of some of them
notable_quotes.context: Said in her garden, overheard by George Crenelé

notable_quotes.speaker: Maire of Fribourg (to Didier Chatron about Odile)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle pouvoit bien besogner et qu'elle estoit une femme de nuict, que sy elle ne se fut retirée hors dudit Fribourg, elle fut esté bruslée
notable_quotes.english: that she could work well enough and that she was a woman of the night, that if she had not withdrawn from Fribourg, she would have been burned
notable_quotes.context: Maire of Fribourg commenting on why Odile left that village

notable_quotes.speaker: Hans Grand Bernard's daughter threatened by Odile
notable_quotes.french: elle leur feroit tant de mal qu'il s'en sauleroit
notable_quotes.english: she would do them so much harm that they would remember it
notable_quotes.context: Threat after being taken to court for stealing logs

notable_quotes.speaker: Warin Manouvrier reports Odile said
notable_quotes.french: que le diable luy ouisse arracher la teste du corps du deposant et qu'il en avoit menty
notable_quotes.english: that the devil should tear the head from the body of the witness and that he lied
notable_quotes.context: Dispute over piglets in bean garden

notable_quotes.speaker: Martin Claude (Odile's husband) responding to witch accusation
notable_quotes.french: S'il vous semble qu'elle soit telle faicte la brusler
notable_quotes.english: If it seems to you that she is such, have her burned
notable_quotes.context: Response when Jacquot Colas le Maire called his wife a witch publicly 12 years earlier

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Blanchar reports Odile said
notable_quotes.french: pauvre compagnon, tu as bien de mal de ce que tu ne peulx recouvrir d'ung cher, nous estions dernierement en telle peine, car nous avions affaire d'une rouëe pour mettre à l'un de noz chers, et cerchions par tout le village mais nou n'en sceurons recouvrir sy tu ne nous en eusse prestee une des tiennes. L'on dict que je suis genoxe, je vouldrois estre diable tout à faict, j'en ferois tant que d'aulcuns s'en repentiroient longtemps.
notable_quotes.english: poor companion, you have much trouble because you cannot recover a cart, we were recently in such difficulty, because we needed a wheel to put on one of our carts, and we searched throughout the village but we could not recover one unless you had lent us one of yours. They say I am a witch, I wish I were a devil completely, I would do so much that some would repent it for a long time.
notable_quotes.context: Said to Jean Blanchar 2 weeks before St Rémy, 3 days before his horse died

notable_quotes.speaker: Odile Claude during interrogation
notable_quotes.french: mais que la femme n'est pas maitre et qu'il appartient au marit de s'en venger
notable_quotes.english: but that the woman is not master and that it belongs to the husband to take revenge for it
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why she did not seek legal redress when called a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Neze to Odile
notable_quotes.french: qu'il faloit qu'elle fut de leur compagnie et qu'elle voiroit des choses qu'elle n'avoit jamais veue
notable_quotes.english: that she had to be in their company and that she would see things she had never seen
notable_quotes.context: Persuading Odile to attend second sabbat meeting

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of Schrempen Nickel and his wife Guele
her mother, previously executed as a witch

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes mentioned: 1) Gaspar Cousturier dispute over alleged debt of 20 gros (went to court at Dieuze, judgment in favor of witness); 2) Didier Chatron as maire had to take security for payment of aides (taxes); 3) Hans Grand Bernard caught Odile's husband stealing 4 loads of logs from his woodland, took him to court at Dieuze; 4) Didier Tixerant's children took harness as caution for damage done by Odile's husband's horses; 5) Jacquot Colas le Maire dispute over price of cartload of hay; 6) Warin Manouvrier dispute over broken pots for which Odile had to pay; 7) Jean Blanchar mentions Odile needing to borrow a wheel for their cart, suggesting economic stress

Garrison left from there and lodged overnight at Fribourg

Odile went through stable door to fly to sabbat; hid the host in stable
Others said they went up chimney to fly to sabbat

historical_context.military_details: Garrison left Sarrebourg and lodged overnight at Fribourg about 11 years before trial (ca. 1589). Odile sent soldiers to fetch flour from Didier Colas's house during this military lodging, which led to conflict.
weather_events: frost - confession mentions going to beat water and cause frost
storms - attempts to make storms frustrated by ringing of church bells
animal_predation: wolves killed multiple horses: Didier Chatron's young horse, 2 horses of Didier Tixerant after threat about wolves
economic_hardship_indicators: taking security for payment of aides (taxes)
need to borrow cart wheel suggests economic stress
disputes over small amounts like 20 gros and broken pots
religious_calendar_references: last Rogations - when Caspar Cousturier's wife went out of her mind
last Easter - when Didier Chatron's horses went to drink
previous Lent - when Hans Grand Bernard caught husband with logs
2 weeks before St Rémy - when Jean Blanchar encountered Odile
day after Christmas - when Odile had vision in prison
before Mass - when Warin's wife ate pears
Vespers - time allowed for Odile to reconsider during torture

prior_legal_disputes.description: Gaspar Cousturier and wife dispute with Odile over alleged debt of 20 gros; husbands summoned to Dieuze
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: judgement went in favour of witness (Gaspar Cousturier)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Hans Grand Bernard caught Odile's husband carting 4 loads of logs from his woodland; took him to court at Dieuze
Thiebault Parmentier called Odile a witch and was taken before justice at Fribourg
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: her husband withdrew case, saying costs would be too great

prior_legal_disputes.description: Didier Tixerant's children took harness as caution for damage done by Odile's husband's horses
Horse belonging to Odile's husband knocked over shelf breaking pots; Odile had to pay

legal_context.redress_outcome: When maire of Fribourg called her witch publicly, her husband said 'if it seems to you that she is such, have her burned' but took no action. Odile explained during interrogation that 'the woman is not master and that it belongs to the husband to take revenge for it'
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Vision in prison morning after Christmas; disturbance in prison noted

hearsay_chains.content: Maire said she was 'a woman of the night' and if she had not left Fribourg she would have been burned
Had heard that if she had stayed longer at Fribourg she would have been burned
Had heard of reputation at Fribourg and of accusations she had disregarded
Thought in view of curse she had given him at time, as others reported to him, she was responsible

emotional_state_notes: During interrogation continued to deny virtually all accusations
Maintained denials of many circumstantial details
When racked finally induced to confess under extreme duress
Asked to be released to reconsider; allowed until Vespers
Still denied at Vespers but gave way when prepared for fresh torture

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony (16 witnesses), clear timeline, and full confession under torture. Multiple economic disputes (debts, property damage, theft) preceded witchcraft accusations. Strong pattern of quarrel-threat-harm sequence. Notable that Odile's mother was previously executed as a witch. Odile moved from Fribourg to Assenoncourt 5 years before trial, possibly to escape growing reputation. Trial shows typical progression: reputation evidence, specific maleficia allegations (mostly animal deaths, some human illness/death), denial, torture, confession to sabbat attendance and deliberate maleficia, death sentence. Confession includes classic elements: devil seduction with false money, cold sexual intercourse, renunciation of God, sabbat attendance with dancing/feasting, flying to sabbat on fork, weather magic frustrated by church bells, making poisonous powders from children's bodies, naming accomplices. Gender dynamics noted in Odile's statement that 'woman is not master' regarding seeking legal redress.
